definition: member of the US House of Representatives

sentences.english: This congressman is clever at making scores off hecklers at public meetings.
sentences.chinese: 這位國會議員擅長在公衆集會上駁倒詰難者。

sentences.english: The following is the text of Senator Clinton's letter today to the Secretary of the Army.
sentences.chinese: 全文如下參議員克林頓的一封信，今天陸軍大臣。

sentences.english: I just received a terribly grhvacious cisl from Sen. McCain.
sentences.chinese: 剛剛，麥凱恩參議員很有風範地給我打了個電話。

sentences.english: The rebel lawmakers denounced his proposal as reckless.
sentences.chinese: 內訌的議員斥責他的提案不顧後果。

sentences.english: Do you agree that only elected District Council members should take part in the election?
sentences.chinese: 是否贊成只由民選區議員參與互選？

sentences.english: There was more  name-calling in the campaign for senator than I ever heard before.
sentences.chinese: 在那次參議員競選中相互謾罵之多是我聞所未聞的。

sentences.english: Today would have been Senator Kennedy’s 79th birthday.
sentences.chinese: 今天是肯尼迪議員先生的79歲誕辰。

sentences.english: The agreement still requires ratification from the full Senate and the Russian Duma.
sentences.chinese: 該協議仍然需要參議院全體議員和俄羅斯杜馬的批准。

sentences.english: One such raid came while Evazan was hosting a dinner for the Andoan Senator.
sentences.chinese: 有一次襲擊甚至發生在埃瓦贊款待那位安多議員時。

sentences.english: The 435 members of the House are elected every two years.
sentences.chinese: 最少每五年舉行一次普選來選舉下議院議員。

sentences.english: You know, councillor, the Manx parliament.
sentences.chinese: 您曉得，參議員，是曼克斯議會。

sentences.english: At least two women must be elected from each province.
sentences.chinese: 每個省必須選出兩名女性議員。

sentences.english: The congressman launched a strong attack on the president's misconduct.
sentences.chinese: 議員猛烈抨擊了總統的胡作非爲。

sentences.english: Do you agree that most of the new seats in the 4th sector should be allocated to District Council members?
sentences.chinese: 是否贊成第四界別的新增議席，大部分分配給區議員？

sentences.english: He became a Congressman at the young age of 29 and brought his frontier swagger to the Senate a year later.
sentences.chinese: 他29歲成爲議員並在一年後昂首闊步進入參議院。

definition: Carrie Lam (1957-), chief executive of Hong Kong 2017-, full name 林鄭月娥|林郑月娥[Lin2 Zheng4 Yue4 e2] Carrie Lam Cheng Yuet-ngor
to fight against/to oppose/to be opposed to/opposition
to be a candidate in an election or other selection process/to run for office/to turn out to vote
